title: Women's Suffrage
description: Learn about the remarkable struggle for women's right to vote across the globe

questions.question: Which country was the first self-governing nation to grant women the right to vote in national elections in 1893?
In the United States, the 19th Amendment granting women the right to vote was ratified in which year?
Which American suffragist was arrested for voting illegally in 1872 and is depicted on the U.S. dollar coin?
The Seneca Falls Convention of 1848, a landmark event in the women's rights movement, took place in which state?
Emmeline Pankhurst was a leading figure in the suffragette movement in which country?
British suffragettes were known for using what type of protest tactics?
options: Militant actions including hunger strikes and property damage

questions.question: Women in France did not gain the right to vote until which year?
Finland became the first European country to grant women full suffrage in which year?
Emily Davison, a British suffragette, died after stepping in front of a horse at which famous event in 1913?
The Declaration of Sentiments, modeled on the Declaration of Independence, was produced at which event?
options: The National Woman Suffrage Association meeting

questions.question: Which amendment to the U.S. Constitution specifically granted women the right to vote?
Women in Switzerland did not gain the right to vote in federal elections until which surprisingly late year?
Who is considered the author of the Declaration of Sentiments at the Seneca Falls Convention?
The National American Woman Suffrage Association (NAWSA) was led by which suffragist during the final push for the 19th Amendment?
Alice Paul and the National Woman's Party organized pickets outside whose residence to demand women's suffrage?
